info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW BAND... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of 20 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1159 AM MST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Craig to 14 miles southeast of Rangely and moving east at 20 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Craig, Hayden, Axial, Loyd, Juniper Springs and Hamilton. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 77 and 106. Colorado 13 between mile markers 53 and 106. Colorado 64 between mile markers 44 and 71. Colorado 139 between mile markers 56 and 61. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
